alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coweta; Heard (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 12:24PM EST until January 06 at 2:56PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Georgia... Chattahoochee River near Whitesburg affecting Heard, Coweta and Carroll Counties. For the Chattahoochee River Basin...including Whitesburg...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chattahoochee River near Whitesburg. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21 feet, Moderate flooding begins. Significant flooding occurs in the woodlands and fields upstream and downstream from the gage. The Riverside Park next to the bridge will be under two feet of water. Flood waters will surround some homes at the end of Bob Brewster Road. Moore Creek will back up and flood portions of Payton Road near Cliff Payton Circle. The water reaches the top of the boat ramp at the day use area and the top of the steps at the north camping site in the Chattahoochee Bend State Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 13.9 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 22.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 17 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
